name: Saguaro Cactus
description: A large, iconic cactus native to the Sonoran Desert.
long_description: The Saguaro Cactus is one of the most recognizable desert plants due to its towering height and branching arms. Native to the Sonoran Desert in the southwestern United States and Mexico, it can live for over 150 years and grow up to 12 meters tall. This slow-growing cactus begins to develop its characteristic arms after about 75 years. The Saguaro stores water in its spongy tissue, allowing it to survive long periods of drought.

name: Joshua Tree
description: A tree-like yucca plant found in the Mojave Desert.
long_description: The Joshua Tree is a unique desert plant that grows in the arid regions of the southwestern United States, particularly in the Mojave Desert. Named by Mormon settlers who thought the plant's outstretched branches resembled the biblical figure Joshua raising his hands in prayer, it can grow up to 15 meters tall.

name: Golden Barrel Cactus
description: A round cactus with golden-yellow spines, native to Mexico.
long_description: The Golden Barrel Cactus is a popular desert plant known for its distinctive round shape and bright yellow spines. Native to the central highlands of Mexico, it thrives in arid environments and well-drained soil. The cactus can grow up to 1 meter in height and diameter, making it an eye-catching feature in desert landscapes.

name: Desert Agave
description: A rosette-forming succulent with thick, spiny leaves.
long_description: The Desert Agave is a hardy succulent that forms a rosette of thick, blue-gray leaves with sharp spines along the margins. It produces a tall flowering stalk at the end of its life.

name: Ocotillo
description: A unique desert plant with long, spiny canes and bright red flowers.
long_description: The Ocotillo is a distinct desert plant with long, upright canes covered in small leaves after rain and bright red tubular flowers at the tips. It can grow up to 6 meters tall.
